listitem.para: Using entire disk (sdb) instead of partitions sdb1 works only the 1st time.

The first time you add an unpartitioned disk to a pool you can add it as sdb but when ever the device is reused after destroying the pool you need to use sdbThe partion type GPT gets initialized. Note fdisk cannot handle this partition type.
zpool create fails with "dir is not empty"
The mount point specified is not empty. Make sure that the mount point does not contain any files or directories for the newly created pool to be mounted.
Can you have ZFS as the root filesystem
The current beta release this is not possible. We havent planned to do this in the near future. If you think this is important please drop us a mail.
NFS export and zfs share

NFS export via zfs share or setting the properties is not supported. Although exporting as you would export any other filesystem by making an entry in /etc/exports or exportfs does work there are couple of unresolved bugs in this area which we are working on.
CIFS support?
CIFS export via zfs share or setting the properties is not supported. However sharing with samba is supported.
Dedup
The beta does not support dedup but this will be available in the GA version. The beta supports zpool version 18 where as dedup feature was introduced in version 21.
Direct IO Support
Direct IO falls back to buffered read/write funtions
Permssion denied error while creating file/dir on any Pool in Fedora.
Disable SeLinux.
How to destroy snapshots ?

To destroy the snapshots one needs to check whether the snapshots are automatically mounted or not. Snapshots are automatically mounted under the directory pool-or-fs-mntpt.zfs/snapshot/snapshot-name . Before destroying one needs to unmount the snapshot and then destroy them.
